name: Payment_GetBypaymentNumber
description:
Get a specific Payment
Payment is deprecated, please use CustomerPayment instead.

erp-api-background.description: If a URL value is provided, then API endpoint will be queued and executed in background. When the execution of the background operation is finished, the system will POST the response to the specified URL. The endpoint itself responds in this case with a 202-Accepted status and a reference to a state document for the background operation.

$block: This class represents a Payment in PaymentController. Used by getting data.

$ul: **applicationDate**: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* > The date when a payment is applied to a document (invoice or note). The field display the current business date for tunapplied or partially applied payments and the latest application date for the closed payment
**applicationPeriod**: Mandatory field: The top part > Financial period* > The period to which the payment should be applied, which the system fills in based on the date.
**appliedToDocuments**: The top part > Applied to documents > The total of the documents to which payment is to be applied.
**appliedToOrders**: The top part > Applied to orders > The total of the orders for which payment is reserved, minus the amount transferred to invoice.
**availableBalance**: The top part > Available balance > The amount that has not been applied.
**availableBalanceInCurrency**: Available Balance calculated in your default (base) currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.
**branch**
**cashAccount**: Mandatory field: The top part > Cash account* > The default cash account associated with the payment method; this field is not available for credit notes.
**currency**: The top part > Currency > The currency of the payment document.
**customer**: Mandatory field: The top part > Customer* > The customer who issued the payment.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**
**deductedCharges**: The top part > Deducted charges > The total amount of bank charges deducted by bank from the payment amount on your cash account (bank account).
**errorInfo**
**financeCharges**: The top part > Finance charges > The total on all finance charges applied to this document.
**financialDetails**: Financial Details
**paymentDate**: Financial Details tab > Payment date
**hold**: The top part > Hold >  A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is a draft with the On hold status. This check box is unavailable for debit adjustments.
**invoiceText**: The top part > Invoice text > A user-defined description of the payment. 50 alphanumeric characters.
**lastModifiedDateTime**: Systemgenerated information.
**location**: Mandatory field: The top part > Location* > The customer location associated with the sale.
**countryId**: Location*.
**id**: Click the magnifier > The identifier
**name**: Click the magnifier > The displayed name
**metadata**
**maxPageSize**
**totalCount**
**ordersToApply**: Orders to apply tab >
**paymentAmount**: The top part > Payment amount > The total of the payment that is entered manually.
**paymentAmountInCurrency**: Payment amount calculated in your default (base) currency. This field is applicable if the amount is given in another currency than your default.
**paymentLines**: Documents to apply tab >
**paymentMethod**: The top part > Payment method > The customer's default payment method; this field is not available for credit notes.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**paymentRef**: Mandatory field: The top part > Payment ref.* > A secondary payment reference identifier, which can be a system-generated number or an external reference number entered manually.

**refNbr**: The top part > Ref.no > The unique identifier for the payment. This number is automatically generated by the system for a new payment document, based on the number series	in the AR101000 window.

**status**: The top part > Status > The status of the customer payment, which for a new document is either Balanced or On hold. [On hold, Balanced, Voided, Scheduled, Open, Closed, Pending print, Pending email, Credit hold, CcHold, Reserved]
**type**: The top part > Type > The type of a document. The following types are available: Payment, CreditNote, Prepayment, Customer refund, Void payment, Balance write-off
**writeOffAmount**: The top part > Write-off amount > The amount that has been written off.
**stateLocation**
